TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class CodeAccessPermission : System.Security.IPermission, System.Security.IStackWalk

.class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit CodeAccessPermission extends System.Object implements class System.Security.IPermission, class System.Security.ISecurityEncodable, class System.Security.IStackWalk
Public MustInherit Class CodeAccessPermission Implements IPermission, IStackWalk
public ref class CodeAccessPermission abstract : System::Security::IPermission, System::Security::IStackWalk
type CodeAccessPermission = class interface IPermission interface ISecurityEncodable interface IStackWalk

summary.span: Defines the underlying structure of all code access permissions.

span.span: Defines the underlying structure of all code access permissions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 程式碼存取權限會使用堆疊查核行程，確認所有呼叫端程式碼的已被授與權限。Code access permissions use a stack walk to ensure that all callers of the code have been granted a permission. 權限物件是否`null`，就會處理與狀態的權限物件與相同。If a permission object is `null`, it is handled the same as a permission object with the state . 呼叫堆疊通常會表示向下成長，使方法呼叫堆疊中較高層呼叫的方法較低的呼叫堆疊中。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 繼承者類別必須被授與完全信任才能正確運作，做為安全性基礎結構延伸權限。Inheritors of the class must be granted full trust to function correctly as permissions extending the security infrastructure. 若要判斷是否完全信任，所以繼承者問題如 = `true`和 = `true`。To determine that the inheritors are fully trusted, issues an for = `true` and = `true`. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範衍生自的權限類別。The following code example shows a permission derived from the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個建構函式會初始化型別中的狀態，每次建立衍生類別的執行個體時呼叫。This constructor is called to initialize state in the type whenever an instance of the derived class is created. 雖然您可以明確呼叫這個建構函式，在衍生的類別建構函式的建構函式宣告中，這通常不需要。大多數的編譯器會自動產生的呼叫。Although you can explicitly call this constructor in the constructor declaration of the derived class constructor, this is not usually necessary; most compilers will automatically generate the call for you.

summary.span: Declares that the calling code can access the resource protected by a permission demand through the code that calls this method, even if callers higher in the stack have not been granted permission to access the resource.

span.span: Declares that the calling code can access the resource protected by a permission demand through the code that calls this method, even if callers higher in the stack have not been granted permission to access the resource.

summary.span: Using can create security issues.

span.span: Using can create security issues.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 呼叫堆疊通常會表示向下成長，使方法呼叫堆疊中較高層呼叫的方法較低的呼叫堆疊中。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 呼叫防止來自較低位置之外的程式碼會呼叫這個方法的呼叫堆疊向上繼續進行的呼叫堆疊中的堆疊查核行程。Calling prevents a stack walk originating lower in the call stack from proceeding up the call stack beyond the code that calls this method. 因此，即使在呼叫堆疊中較高的呼叫端沒有必要的使用權限來存取資源，他們還是可以存取它透過呼叫這個方法所需的權限的程式碼。Therefore, even if callers higher on the call stack do not have the requisite permissions to access a resource, they can still access it through the code that calls this method on the necessary permission. 判斷提示是有效的程式碼呼叫時，才通過安全性檢查，它會判斷提示之權限。An assertion is effective only if the code that calls passes the security check for the permission that it is asserting. 若要呼叫呼叫程式碼會傳回其呼叫端才會生效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 只有一個作用中的框架。Only one can be active on a frame. 嘗試呼叫時作用中上的框架會導致有。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 呼叫或移除作用中。Call or to remove an active . 會忽略該權限的要求將會失敗，因為未授與的權限。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed. 不過，如果在呼叫堆疊中較低的程式碼呼叫該權限，堆疊查核行程到達嘗試呼叫的程式碼時，會擲回。However, if code lower on the call stack calls for that permission, a is thrown when the stack walk reaches the code that tried to call . 這是因為程式碼呼叫未被授與權限，即使應用程式嘗試它。This happens because the code that called has not been granted the permission, even though it tried to it. > [!CAUTION] > 因為呼叫移除所有程式碼呼叫鏈結中的需求必須被授與權限可以存取指定的資源，如果使用不正確或不當，它可以開啟安全性的問題。Because calling removes the requirement that all code in the call chain must be granted permission to access the specified resource, it can open up security issues if used incorrectly or inappropriately. 因此，應該使用小心謹慎。Therefore, it should be used with great caution.

summary.span: Forces a at run time if all callers higher in the call stack have not been granted the permission specified by the current instance.

span.span: Forces a at run time if all callers higher in the call stack have not been granted the permission specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法通常可由安全程式庫來確定呼叫端擁有存取資源的權限。This method is typically used by secure libraries to ensure that callers have permission to access a resource. 例如，檔案中的類別安全類別庫的呼叫必要的之前執行檔案作業的呼叫端要求。For example, a file class in a secure class library calls for the necessary before performing a file operation requested by the caller. 不會檢查呼叫這個方法的程式碼的權限;檢查該程式碼的立即呼叫端從開始，然後進行堆疊。The permissions of the code that calls this method are not examined; the check begins from the immediate caller of that code and proceeds up the stack. 呼叫堆疊通常會表示向下成長，使方法呼叫堆疊中較高層呼叫的方法較低的呼叫堆疊中。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 只有當沒有成功，就會引發。 succeeds only if no is raised.

exception.span: A caller higher in the call stack does not have the permission specified by the current instance.

summary.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access the resource specified by the current instance.

span.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access the resource specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法應該只能用來保護資源的意外存取完全信任的程式碼。The method should be used only to protect resources from accidental access by fully trusted code. 它不應要保護資源的刻意誤用，而不受信任的程式碼。It should not be used to protect resources from intentional misuse by untrusted code. 例如，如果方法`A`問題的權限，然後呼叫方法`B`，方法`B`overtly 可以覆寫發出。For example, if method `A` issues a for a permission and then calls method `B`, method `B` can overtly override the by issuing an . 所呼叫的方法一律是在堆疊中較高。The called method is always higher in the stack. 因此，如果方法`B`嘗試存取受保護的資源時，安全性系統會開始檢查它的權限，因為方法`B`是立即呼叫端，上下然後查核行程的堆疊可以確認是否有任何或堆疊中較低。Therefore, if method `B` tries to access a protected resource, the security system begins checking for permissions with it because method `B` is the immediate caller, and then walks down the stack to confirm that there is no or lower in the stack. 方法`B`，這嘗試存取資源，可以堆疊查核行程立即停止使用方法。Method `B`, which is trying to access the resource, can stop the stack walk immediately by using the method. 在此情況下，放置在堆疊上方法`A`永遠不會探索 （呼叫的方法）。In that case, the placed on the stack by method `A` (the calling method) is never discovered. 這個方法會防止呼叫堆疊中較高層的呼叫端程式碼呼叫此方法，透過存取受保護的資源，即使這些呼叫端必須被授與存取權限。This method prevents callers higher in the call stack from accessing the protected resource through the code that calls this method, even if those callers have been granted permission to access it. 呼叫堆疊通常會表示向下成長，使方法呼叫堆疊中較高層呼叫的方法較低的呼叫堆疊中。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 可以限制程式設計人員的責任或協助防止意外安全性問題，因為它可協助避免呼叫此方法從用來存取拒絕的權限所保護的資源。 can limit the liability of the programmer or help prevent accidental security issues because it helps prevent the method that calls from being used to access the resource protected by the denied permission. 如果方法呼叫權限，而且如果到達時，該安全性檢查的呼叫堆疊中較低的呼叫端所叫用該權限時，將會失敗。If a method calls on a permission, and if a for that permission is invoked by a caller lower in the call stack, that security check will fail when it reaches the . 若要呼叫呼叫程式碼會傳回其呼叫端才會生效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 只有一個作用中的框架。Only one can be active on a frame. 嘗試呼叫時作用中上的框架會導致有。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 呼叫或移除作用中。Call or to remove an active . 會忽略該權限的要求將會失敗，因為未授與的權限。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 相同的權限的兩個執行個體的雜湊程式碼可能會不同，因此雜湊程式碼不應比較兩個物件。The hash code for two instances of the same permission might be different, hence a hash code should not be used to compare two objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 兩個權限的交集會描述一組共同兩者描述的作業的權限。The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. 只有通過這兩個原始的使用權限的需求會通過交集。Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範的覆寫方法。The following code example shows an override of the method. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果目前權限會指定一組完全包含所指定的權限的作業，目前的權限會是所指定權限的子集。The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. 例如，表示 C:\example.txt 的存取權限是到 c： 代表存取權限的子集\\。For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. 如果此方法傳回`true`，目前的權限，表示沒有存取受保護的資源比指定的權限。If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission. 下列陳述式必須是`true`所有覆寫的方法。The following statements are required to be `true` for all overrides of the method. *X*， *Y*，和*Z*代表不是 null 參考，自訂程式碼存取權限物件*U*表示無限制的程式碼存取權限和*N*表示空的權限和的。*X*, *Y*, and *Z* represent custom code access permission objects that are not null references, *U* represents an unrestricted code access permission, and *N* represents an empty permission with a of . - *X*。IsSubsetOf (*X*) 傳回`true`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf (*Y*) 傳回相同的值做為*Y*。IsSubsetOf (*X*) 如果且只有*X*和*Y*代表相同的權限集。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) returns the same value as *Y*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) if and only if *X* and *Y* represent the same set of permissions. - 如果*X*。IsSubsetOf (*Y*) 和*Y*。IsSubsetOf (*Z*) 都會傳回`true`， *X*。IsSubsetOf (*Z*) 傳回`true`。If *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) and *Y*.IsSubsetOf(*Z*) both return `true`, *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Z*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf (*U*) 傳回`true`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*U*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf (*N*) 傳回`false`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*N*) returns `false`. - *N*。IsSubsetOf (*X*) 傳回`true`。*N*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) returns `true`. 如果*X*和*Y*代表自訂程式碼存取權限物件是 null 參考， *X*。IsSubsetOf (*Y*) 傳回`true`。If *X* and *Y* represent custom code access permission objects that are null references, *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) returns `true`. 如果*Z*也是 null，複合設定作業*X*。等位 (*Y*)。IsSubsetOf (*Z*) 也會傳回`true`因為兩個 null 的權限的聯集為 null 的權限。If *Z* is also null, the compound set operation *X*.Union(*Y*).IsSubsetOf(*Z*) also returns `true` because the union of two null permissions is a null permission. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範的覆寫方法。The following code example shows an override of the method. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#4)]

summary.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access all resources except for the resource specified by the current instance.

span.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access all resources except for the resource specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法應該只能用來保護資源的意外存取完全信任的程式碼。The method should be used only to protect resources from accidental access by fully trusted code. 它不應要保護資源的刻意誤用，而不受信任的程式碼。It should not be used to protect resources from intentional misuse by untrusted code. 例如，如果方法`A`問題的權限，然後呼叫方法`B`，方法`B`overtly 可以覆寫發出。For example, if method `A` issues a for a permission and then calls method `B`, method `B` can overtly override the by issuing an . 所呼叫的方法一律是在堆疊中較高。The called method is always higher in the stack. 因此，如果方法`B`嘗試存取受保護的資源時，安全性系統會開始檢查它的權限，因為方法`B`是立即呼叫端，上下然後查核行程的堆疊可以確認是否有任何或堆疊中較低。Therefore, if method `B` tries to access a protected resource, the security system begins checking for permissions with it because method `B` is the immediate caller, and then walks down the stack to confirm that there is no or lower in the stack. 方法`B`，這嘗試存取資源，可以堆疊查核行程立即停止使用方法。Method `B`, which is trying to access the resource, can stop the stack walk immediately by using the method. 在此情況下，放置在堆疊上方法`A`永遠不會探索 （呼叫的方法）。In that case, the placed on the stack by method `A` (the calling method) is never discovered. 類似於，在於兩者會導致堆疊查核行程符合則成功時失敗。 is similar to , in that both cause stack walks to fail when they would otherwise succeed. 其差異在於，指定權限，會導致堆疊查核行程失敗，但指定不會導致堆疊查核行程失敗的唯一權限。The difference is that specifies permissions that will cause the stack walk to fail, but specifies the only permissions that do not cause the stack walk to fail. 呼叫此方法，以確保您的程式碼，可用來存取指定的資源。Call this method to ensure that your code can be used to access only the specified resources. 若要呼叫呼叫程式碼會傳回其呼叫端才會生效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 只有一個作用中的框架。Only one can be active on a frame. 嘗試呼叫時作用中上的框架會導致有。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 呼叫或移除作用中。Call or to remove an active . 會忽略該權限的要求將會失敗，因為未授與的權限。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed. 不過，如果程式碼呼叫較低堆疊稍後呼叫該權限，堆疊查核行程到達嘗試呼叫的程式碼時，會擲回。However, if code lower on the call stack later calls for that permission, a is thrown when the stack walk reaches the code that tried to call . 這是因為程式碼呼叫未被授與權限，即使它呼叫該權限。This is because the code that called has not been granted the permission, even though it called for that permission. 呼叫堆疊通常會表示向下成長，使方法呼叫堆疊中較高層呼叫的方法較低的呼叫堆疊中。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack.

exception.span: There is already an active for the current frame.

span.span: There is already an active for the current frame.

span.para: 您無法覆寫這個方法。
You cannot override this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法是用於偵錯時您需要以字串形式顯示權限。This method is useful in debugging when you need to display the permission as a string.

summary.span: When overridden in a derived class, creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.

returns.span: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

span.span: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 擴充安全性物件的自訂程式碼必須實作和方法，以使安全性 encodable 的物件。Custom code that extends security objects needs to implement the and methods to make the objects security-encodable. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範的覆寫方法。The following code example shows an override of the method. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#11)]

param.name: other
param.span: A permission to combine with the current permission.

param.span: It must be of the same type as the current permission.

summary.span: When overridden in a derived class, creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.span: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

span.span: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要呼叫的結果是權限，表示代表的所有作業目前的權限和指定的權限。The result of a call to is a permission that represents all the operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. 傳遞其中一個權限的任何要求會傳遞它們的聯集。Any demand that passes either permission passes their union. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範的覆寫方法。The following code example shows an override of the method. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#12](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#12)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#12)]
